alert.note: Alert for Gwinnett; Walton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 3:16PM EST until January 10 at 12:55AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Georgia... Alcovy River at New Hope Road near Grayson affecting Walton and Gwinnett Counties. For the Alcovy River Basin...including Oxford, Covington, Lawrenceville, Lawrenceville, Grayson, Alcovy River above Covington, Covington, Alcovy River below Covington, Mansfield...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Alcovy River at New Hope Road near Grayson. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Significant flooding continues to expand further into the woodlands upstream and downstream from the river gauge at New Hope Road. The bridge forms an obstacle and acts like a dam causing some backwater and erosion eddies to the sides of the bridge. County officials may need to close the bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 12.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:45 PM EST Tuesday was 12.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage this evening to 6.2 feet and then begin rising late tomorrow morning. It will then rise again to 6.6 feet late tomorrow morning. It will fall to 6.4 feet and then begin rising tomorrow afternoon. It will then rise again to 6.6 feet tomorrow afternoon. It will fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.5 feet on 09/17/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 100 AM EST.
